intro: Microseris major, commonly known as the broadleaf scabious, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are blue to purple in color. Microseris major is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
